page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: {ECOLOGY OF MOBBERLY. {NATURAL HISTORY. PLANTS:- One unusual plant in the area - Lousewort. Also Knopper Gall. ANIMALS:- Wild mink, foxes, bats, moles, rabbits, hares, mice, voles. BIRDS:- Pheasants, herons, pigeons, crows, kingfishers, moorhens, jays, woodpeckers, barn owls, tawney owls, wild ducks, magpies, tits, partridge. BUTTERFLIES:- Tortoiseshell, red admiral, peacock, painted lady, coma, brimstone, clouded yellow. CONSERVATION:- Main conservation project in area is 'The Bollin Valley Project'. Set up in 1972 to re-open and re-establish public footpaths and woodlands and to positively manage the countryside around the river Bollin to the benefit of public, farmers, and wild life. The Project is funded by various public bodies.
